campaign.story:
The Draft Top 2.0
 “Drinking Topless Since ‘12” 
PLAY

 Production sample in action
As seen on:
Want to help us spread the word and make a little something for yourself? Click the image below:
What is The Draft Top tool?
Explosion not guaranteed
The Draft Top tool is a patent pending bar tool designed to remove the top of almost any can.  
The result is a topless can that enhances your drinking experience and allows you to do things with the can that you never thought you could.
 Not to mention the innovative design safely removes the top leaving no sharp edges. 
The Draft Top can be used on most 8-19 oz beverage cans. 
Are you a beer drinker? 
Good news, the Draft Top tool works on Domestic, Imported, and Craft Beers
Don’t drink beer, no problem!
 The Draft Top tool also works on Spiked Seltzers, Canned Wine, Canned Cocktails, Energy Drinks, Iced Coffee, Soda/Seltzer, and much more.
Why Drink Topless?
There are many reasons why you should Drink Topless, but here are just a few.
 A smooth pour
Removing the top allows for an uninterrupted pour. Leaving you less full and ready to grab another. Ditch the glass and drink straight from the can.
Imagine the mugs as your stomach....
Enjoy the full taste 
By removing the entire top, the Draft Top tool allows your nose to enjoy the aroma of your beverage instead of the aluminum top. Enhancing the flavor and allowing you to enjoy it as if it were a glass.
You have to be classy when drinking wine in a can
Garnish your drinks
Spicing up your favorite canned drinks is even easier when you Drink Topless. Whether you like cocktails or just a little citrus in your beer, we've got you un-covered.
Send It
 By opening the entire top, the Draft Top tool allows you to drink from the can even faster. Great for showing off your skills to your friends or for das bootsrennen.
Be like Jesse and Drink Topless
Getting Creative
 Topless cans are perfect for those right-brained individuals who want to get their craft on.
They are also perfect for those who just want to play drinking games such as beer pong or beer die.
Ping pong balls sold separately
This was not our first try...
How to Use the Draft Top
Drinking Topless only takes 4 simple steps.
1. Grab top edge of can
Or bottom edge of can
Don't grab the center of the can! 
2. Open Handle and place tool on the top of the can
3. Squeeze handle and rotate
4. Align rim with handle notches and slowly rock to open the top

How Does it Work?
 When the handle is squeezed, it forces the center gear to rotate causing each of the four splitters to synchronously extend towards the rim of the can allowing the Draft Top tool to open a variety of can sizes. 
Watch the Draft Top bar tool opening different sized cans (CAD model shown)
Durable Design
The tool is made of high impact ABS plastic allowing it to withstand the wear and tear of every day life such as:
A night in a cooler
An accidental encounter with your car... We're just trying to prove a point, there's no need to celebrate it Frank!
Engineered for Performance
The splitters are designed to be safe to the touch and last for hundreds of cans and likely more.
Small enough to take on the go
The Draft Top is about the size of most smartphones and can easily fit into your pocket.
The Draft Top tool is smaller than your average smartphone
Simply click the handle closed for safe storage and slip it into your pocket to take it anywhere.
Interested in Co-Branding?
We have designed the Draft Top tool to be easily customized to help promote your brand.  Just give us your logo and pick  your colors.
CAD models shown
Co-branding is not available during Kickstarter, please contact us at hello@drafttop.com for more information.

How did we get here?
Proudly American Made
It was very important for us to keep manufacturing here in the States. Not only does it help speed up delivery times and improve quality for our customers, but it allows us to utilize a network of talented manufacturers across the country. We are very pleased with the quality and support we have received from our vendors and look forward to working with them for future orders and products!
One of the injection molding machines in our manufacturer's facility
Production Has Begun
From design to prototyping, tooling to production, the Draft Top tool has already started its journey from idea to reality. Take a look at what we've been up to.
PLAY

One of the Draft Top tool's molds being manufactured
PLAY

 Production parts being made in an injection molding machine
Draft Top tools in their packaging
Hell or High Water - We're Making this Product
As you can see we have already initiated production for this product, so it’s not a question of “IF” you will be rewarded with the product but “WHEN”. We have proven to deliver on our promise in the past and fully intend to do it again.
                Thank you for your support because without you we wouldn’t be here!!! 
Drink Topless 
The Draft Top team

FAQ's
 Why would I want this? Instead of smashing your nose against the aluminum top, you can smell the aroma of your drink. Not to mention a smooth pour and no clugging which makes you feel full. Or just Send It. 
 When will this be delivered? We are anticipating early 2020. 
 Do you ship overseas? Yes. Separate shipping rates apply.
 Can you get different colors? There will be additional color options in the future. Sign up for details or contact us at hello@drafttop.com 
 Are you able to put another logo on the Draft Top? Yes, but not during Kickstarter. Minimum orders apply. Reach out to us at hello@drafttop.com for more details
 Does it leave a sharp edge? No, the cut occurs inside the rim of the can and folds the aluminum into the rim.  
 Are the blades sharp? No, in fact they are purposefully dull. We call them splitters. Technically they are splitting the metal and not cutting it.
 Will the splitters rust? If left in water for a few days or covered in soda or beer there is a likelihood that they will develop surface rust. They are made of 300 series stainless.  
 Can it be washed/is it dishwasher safe? We don't recommend using it in the dishwasher as it could affect longevity of the tool. We recommend just rinsing it using warm water after each session. 
 How long will it last? We've tested samples on hundreds of cans and have prototypes that are still being used well above 1,000 cans 
 Does it grab the top? No. If the top falls completely in, you have to flip it on its side and pull it out. If it partially cuts the lid, you can use the tool to fold it into the can like the tab normally folds in. 
 So the top just falls in the can? Sometimes. It all depends on how the tool is used. If it partially cuts the lid, you can use the tool to fold it into the can like the tab normally folds in. 
 Isn't the top dirty? Maybe but its the same top that you put your lips on when drinking from the can the normal way. So just Drink Topless! Its a lot better.  
 Does it work on Tall boys? Yes, most 16oz to 19oz cans. It does not work on most 24oz cans or the Fosters Oil Can
 Does it work on crowlers? No - those are good for a nice set of glasses
 How does it work? When holding the tool in either hand, the top right corner has a part of the handle that sticks out. When you push this in the handle opens and retracts the splitters to the center. With the opposite hand holding the can near the top or bottom near the bends, you place the tool on the can and slowly squeeze while starting to rotate. The four splitters move outward from the center when you squeeze the handle. They puncture the inside rim of the can just below the top and split the aluminum open as you rotate the tool. A minimum of a quarter twist is needed to fully remove the top but sometimes it take a half or full twist. Below the handle are grooves designed to allow you to rest them on the rim and push the lid in. Remember, the objective is to open the top not take the lid out.   
 Do you or will you sell replacement parts? Not at this time. 
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 950+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $400M raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
While there is always a potential for unknown’s to occur, the only challenge we can foresee at this time is uncertainty of delivery times based on the volume of orders. In order to afford the tooling ahead of Kickstarter we choose to go with single cavity mold which limits the rate of production. Our manufacturer is capable of handling larger volumes, but the delivery times will likely be delayed. The product will be fulfilled on a first come first serve basis so later backers will have to wait a little longer to receive their reward.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
CAVEAT: We've found SCAMMERS "selling" Footloose. Please be careful about any FAKE websites. Kickstarter and CrowdOx.com (our post-campaign pledge management platform) are the only official channels for backing Footloose.
Cleaning litter boxes is certainly an unpleasant routine. But what was your feeling last time when confronted a toilet un-flushed? Gotcha! I mean, felines have a well-earned reputation as immaculate creatures. They need a clean toilet just like we do.
Footloose is invented to keep your cats' treasure-burying ground always clean. Each time after they finish their business, Footloose starts an 8-min countdown and then initiates a cleaning cycle that funnels all wastes into a tightly-sealed receptacle. All you've to do is to discard the waste bag once in a while.
OmniClean Technology
Existing contraptions have failed what they're built for. Most of them break down within a year of purchase. While cleaning, they cause a lot of waste debris or even get themselves polluted. It feels like you would rather just scoop the litter at the outset.
So we developed OmniClean technology that actually works. The meticulous fusion of hive-style sieve, curvy funnel, fine-tuned turning speed and powerful torque is a result of our unwavering engineering pursuit. Then with a little blessing of the gravitational force, it turns the arduous frustration into a hassle-free pleasure.
A Zero-Compromise Solution
Footloose is a real life hack that embodies our zero-compromise ethos. We invented this system so that you can say goodbye to scooping without compromising on other aspects.
Footloose is the smartest littering robot you can ever imagine. SiftAutonomy algorithms give it the intelligence to recognize each critter in multi-cat households, distinguish litter from cats, detect its perimeter and monitor waste level. To enable that, Footloose includes 3 weight sensors, 4 position gauges, a 360° millimeter-wave transceiver, 2 infrared sensors and 2 powerful computing cores.
The Wireless Litter Box System
After unboxing, pair up Footloose with your home WiFi via Smart Config. It'll stay connected thus you can control it in the Petato App wherever you're. Tweak settings that suit you better and do update firmware for new features in the future.
According to veterinarians, potty behavior is a barometer of health. The advantage of scooping is probably that you can check the waste to see whether your cat is in a good shape. But this is the one thing people always ignore until something bad happens.
With ActiveTrack, we can now proactively monitor cats' physical conditions. Footloose indicates you when there is an anomaly. Some symptoms are difficult to spot by human eyes but can hardly hide from the robots. For example, increased attempts to urinate with small volumes is barely noticeable by human but can be a serious sign of urinary problems.
All data is streamed to your smartphone for reference at any time. We can't generalize a Ph.D thesis topic into several lines here but at the bottom line, these data points are highly helpful for diagnosis when you visit a vet's office.
The debate over open or hooded box is unsettled. Though every pet cat is different, it can be inferred from their outdoor equivalents that the need for fresh air, large space, and relatively sheltered spot is universal. It's this cat-centric philosophy that gives birth to Footloose's form factors.
Good for Small or Old Cats
To facilitate smaller or elder cats with reduced agility, a doorstep is provided. Additionally, the upper surface of the receptacle is engraved with a cascade pattern that serves as a step for in and out.
Sympathy for The Weaker
If you've two or more cats, there may be a hierarchy in their society. Those who are less dominant may often get harassed while toileting. However, in the raised chamber, they look taller hence are less prone to a fight put up by another aggressive cat.
100% Safe & Secure
All the current self-cleaning litter boxes have one common issue: while the mechanical parts are moving, cats can still get inside, unnoticed. In edge cases, this even leads to fatal injuries, especially for petite cats or other small pets such as ferrets.
Footloose is totally safe & secure thanks to three layers of protection. As our signature design, the chamber opening closes while spinning, which prevents cats from entering. More proactively, a millimeter-wave detector picks up any motion of pet or kid within the 30 cm range. It stops the machine right away and resumes after the perimeter is cleared. Lastly, if a tiny critter manages to get in from above, the agile weight sensors can pick up even the slightest change and alert the owner immediately. 
Litter box odor is annoying. But Footloose is here to help. Physically, the waste receptacle is concealed as airtight as possible. There won't be any waste exposed in the open air. On the other hand, the stench you smell is mainly ammonia and some sulfide compounds - they get decomposed by a deodorizing unit.
The process is known as photocatalysis, same technology used by NASA in space missions. During the process, UV light energizes the catalyst (mainly titanium dioxide, TiO2) rested in the porous zeolite materials, triggering chemical reactions that neutralize the odor at molecular level, and producing primarily carbon dioxide and water as byproducts.
Footloose works with any cat litter that clumps, as well as silica gel crystals. Our ingenious hexagonal sifting holes are designed to allow litter of different sizes and shapes to pass through efficiently. They're optimized such that no litter will be left out or wasted. When litter returns to the chamber, the pliable sieve lets it fall gently, which minimizes dust.
We've experimented all kinds of litter, including the most popular clumping clay. However, we notice that bentonite granules often get stuck within cats' paws. These granules can be swallowed by cats when they are licking the paws. It's very dangerous as clay is non-digestible. As for crystals, they usually have ragged surfaces, which is not ideal for cats because with a large concentration of nerve receptors, their paws are sensitive. Therefore, we use the biodegradable corn litter mostly now. And it works perfectly well with Footloose.
Litter tracking and spillage are minimized with Footloose. Holes on the doorstep helps stretch cats' paws to get rid of the granules. Also, as cats jump out of the box from above, litter is tracked within a small area outside the single opening, better than all the place in your house.
We used almost all self-cleaning litter boxes available on the market. We were confused by those "more advanced" models. The buttons, lights, colors, blinks, etc. were overwhelming. Let alone the glitches that require troubleshooting frequently.
Features, from our perspective, shall not override usability. Footloose is equipped with a crispy LED display and only one button. The display shows machine status that is worth noticing, including Countdown, Cleaning, Emptying, Pairing, Error and Full. The button is mostly used for manually triggering or pausing a cleaning cycle.
Interactions Made Easy
We're committed to deliver you the best possible user experience. The functional details are not only ergonomic, but also proven highly useful in different scenarios.
Designed to safeguard your furry friends as well as your wallet, Footloose is a one-time investment that saves you both time and money. Paying for custom-made liners, cat litter, waste receptacles, cartridges or other replacements should be an option, not a voluntary-but-mandatory cost to claim the benefits of automation.
Note: Assume 2 cats. Detailed calculations are available in this shared spreadsheet.
At Petato, it's our innovative minds that set us apart. We're a passionate team of designers, engineers and social entrepreneurs who are true ailurophiles. We bring objects to life through creative designs, robotics and artificial intelligence, allowing people to live smarter with their furry friends and turning people's home into a utopia for pets.
Our Founder Byron always knew he wanted to create disruptive tech to make things easier for pets and pet parents. The idea for Petato began after hearing friends were giving away their pets because of pregnancy or their busy schedules. This led to taking on the challenge of creating an automatic cat toilet that would enable cat owners to take better care of the fur-kids. Prior to founding Petato, Byron spent 3 years and contributed to its skyrocketing growth at DJI where his last role was the project manager for Matrice drones, FlightHub and other commercial application products. He was also the lead DJI rep of the SkyFund through which an ecosystem around drone platforms was developed from the ground up.
Why Kickstarter?
We've completed design for manufacturing & assembly (DFMA) reviews. The next step is to create the tools that are necessary to manufacture different plastic parts of Footloose. Given the size of it, the biggest tool we're talking about will be as long as 4 ft in one direction. In contrast, a tool for your earbuds is just the size of a Coke can. Tooling cost of Footloose is about $300K. Though we're committed to deliver this product whatsoever, it'd be helpful to have a clear visibility of how many units we need to produce in the first batch.
 Video by Launch Light Films
This project is promoted by Jellop, the ad tech power behind the best Kickstarters with 500+ successful Kickstarter projects with over $235MM raised between them.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We’re dedicated to delivering a flawless product, and you can rest assured that we'll do everything to fulfill your expectations. This is not our first Kickstarter campaign, and we've smoothed out many potential problems that may arise with production and fulfillment.

PRODUCT
We spent tireless months enjoying the process of bringing Footloose to life. Now Footloose is almost complete. We've painstakingly chosen all the materials and production processes involved in the making of Footloose. However, there may be slight changes made to the finished product that will be shipped out to you. In any case, we promise to update you promptly and explain the nature and rationale behind any change.

PRODUCTION 
We've already included holidays in the schedule. We work in very close collaboration with our manufacturer to ensure everything runs smoothly. Nevertheless, unexpected delays in production are still a possibility and may push back our estimated delivery date. We promise to keep you in the loop at all times and be fully transparent with you every step of the way.

TRADE AFFAIRS
We'll be shipping you Footloose directly from our contract manufacturer in the Shenzhen area. For US backers, generally there will be no import duty for goods with a value lower than $800. However, we don't know where the "trade war" between US and China is heading or whether any tariff will be imposed. We had no issue shipping previous Kickstarter pledges but we'll keep a close eye on the latest policy.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The Dreamcade Replay is the universal flashback console that plays nearly every classic console from the 70's through the 90's. Pricing is just $99, $129, or $159 each.
It includes over 100 classic games & it's simple to play tens of thousands more.
Play arcades games, pinball machines, casino games, slot machines, MP3's, movies, and so much more. Super simple to use, with no messy controller cables. Works on almost all modern TV's and computers. Just plug it in and enjoy!
Whether it's Pac-Man, or Pokemon, the Replay plays tens of thousands of games from dozens of different platforms. It comes pre-configured with everything you need. From Intellivision to the PlayStation and most anything in between.
The Dreamcade Replay is simple to play and add more games.
  Order today and save $20-$40, plus get extra free games.
Three configurations to choose from:
Option 1. Replay BYOC $̶1̶1̶9̶  $99 - Bring Your Own Controller. Works with almost any PC or Bluetooth gamepad.
Option 2. Replay DX $̶1̶5̶9̶  $129 - Includes everything you need, just plug it in and enjoy!
Option 3. Replay DX2 $̶1̶9̶9̶  $159 - Includes a second controller, for twice as much fun.
The Replay supports over 2 dozen systems out of the box. Here's just a few: Sega Game Gear, Genesis, & Master System; Nintendo Original (NES), Super(SNES), 64 (N64), & Game Boy. Plus, it plays PC classics like the Commodore, Apple, and Spectrum. And with our open system users can add and even share additional emulators.
Each system not only comes with over 100 classic games, but it also includes Pinball machines, Casino and slot games (these can be removed), and many apps to get the most out of your Replay.
Our exclusive Retro-Reload Google Safe Search takes the worry out of finding new games. Whether it's commercial sites like Steam Powered, Good Old Gamer, or online libraries like the Internet Archive, we make sure your searches are always family-safe, and virus free.
With our Retro Streaming Accelerator, streaming games is as simple as clicking a link. In fact, there's over 10,000 free games to stream on the Internet Archive alone--all of which play full-screen and full-speed, thanks to our exclusive streaming technology.
Here's a list of just some of the FREE games you can stream:
Internet Arcade - Defender, Q-bert, Out Run, and over 600 more!
Console Living Room - Pitfall, Frogger, Star Wars, and thousands more!
Software Collection - Oregon Trail, Wolfenstien 3D, Donkey Kong and over 10,000 more!
Don't worry if these games run slow or poorly on your home PC, our streaming software technology allows them to run at full-speed without glitches.
Start digging around your closet or garage for those old games, because it's simple to add your cartridge titles to your Replay. Simply take a photo, and our Cartridge Analysis & Recognition Tool (CART) will identify and add it to your list of titles, it's that easy. It works with iPhone, Android, Kindle, Mac, PC—anything with a web browser and camera.
 The controller included with the Replay DX automatically connects when turned on, so you never have to worry about connecting your controller, plus it functions as a mouse and keyboard. If you want to use your own controller or add more players (up to 4) the Dreamcade Replay recognizes over 100 gamepads.
Our joystick configurator not only lets you reconfigure your gamepad to suit your preferences, but it also allows you to add new controllers with ease. With the Replay there's never any rebooting required; new controllers are automatically recognized and ready to play within seconds.
Dream Arcades continuously updates and improves the software used on full-sized arcades. You'll have access to the same exact software used on those arcades. Best of all, we are always working on adding new emulators and other features to the Replay. You do have the option to opt-out of these free upgrades.  
Our support is unrivaled, we can even remotely connect to your machine and fix it over the internet.
Because the Replay runs Windows 10, it supports thousands of apps and programs. Plus, the Replay comes with dozens of the most useful ones, like: Windows Store, Netflix, Amazon Video, and YouTube (we are not affiliated with these companies).        
    When it comes to emulation, CPU power is everything. Running quad-cores at over 2.2GHz turbo means the Replay can not only handle emulators, but also more recent titles like Street Fighter 4 and Counter-Strike. Our open system allows you to expand and hack to your heart's content.
The system comes with an Intel Processor, 4GB RAM, Bluetooth, wireless and Ethernet networking, 32GB storage, USB 2.0 & 3.0, HDMI, VGA, and the ability to expand with up to 3 additional storage devices.
  Don't compare the Replay to a Raspberry Pi. Pi based machines run at half the speed, and can't run as many emulators--like N64, or Playstation--without lots of stuttering. Additionally, they run freeware, limited front-ends. Our front-end has been designed from the ground up for ease-of-use and powerful customization.
 International Backers:
Don't see your country listed? Just message us with your country, city, and postal code and we'll try to add it the the list. Unfortunately, we cannot ship to Canada at this time.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Michael Ware started out as a guy in a garage, and over the past fourteen years, we've grown a cutting-edge company with a 5,000 square-foot facility, complete with dedicated support, programming, and engineering staff. Michael has been working with overseas manufactures for over eight years and knows the ins-and-outs of manufacturing and importing. While there is risk with any project, we have the experience, to make the Replay a reality.
While prototypes are being sent out to the media and bloggers, the Replay is not yet a complete product.
The layout of one of the PCB’s may need to be changed to accommodate the molds. But the most critical and time consuming part— the initial design—is complete. We are currently beta testing software and hardware. 
Like any project, one of the biggest risks is unexpected delays. Overseas manufacturing works very differently than in the US, and delays are sometimes unavoidable. We’ve lined up multiple manufactures to minimize the impact of any delays and are committed to keeping candid communication on our progress with backers. 
While we’re experienced at cost forecasting, there’s always a chance that some features might be modified or excluded. The online social experience still has to be finalized. 
Overseas orders could face issues or additional costs in local customs. Dreamcade llc has the experience to properly fill-out customs forms, but we cannot guarantee there won't be customs delays. We recommend buyers hire a customs broker to resolve any local customs issues, which we can not be liable for. In the event of cancellation of this project, Dreamcade, llc will refund 100% of all fees collected, whenever possible.
Software licensing has been negotiated but not yet signed for game packs. Titles may change. 
Special thanks to Evan Amos for his Creative Commons Console images!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
It's been quite a while since the last update, so there's a lot to tell.
First, I apologize for the lateness of this update. Everyone's been waiting on the big patch to address the outstanding issues that some Replays are having with some TV's, and some controllers. Due to its size, we have separated the patch into two sections. After testing we released the first of the two patches about two weeks ago. Everyone should now have it whether or not they are in the early adopter's program.
That first patch addressed several little bugs like Vsync in MAME and N64 sound. The second half will address issues with configuring controllers. Specifically, it will connect any Xinput controller to the Replay without having to do any configuration. Since most modern controllers use Xinput, it should make the process of adding and connecting controllers much simpler. However, if you have an older controller, you can still use the configuration you setup, or create a new one.

I apologize it's been so long since our last update. The holidays are our busiest time of year, and things are finally getting back to normal.
We've had 2 programmers working on a big update to the Replay. This will make both the initial setup and joystick recognition much simpler; there's also a lot of smaller fixes and improvements, like integrating both the VSync and N64 sound fixes into the menu. 
The setup changes are complete, but the overhauling of the joystick recognition is a major change. So we're aiming for release around the end of February. Once we get the release out to backers we'll start selling the Replay again.

We’re releasing patches to address some minor bugs, and also make the Replay faster and easier to use. We’ll continue to release minor patches and updates as needed. However, we are currently working towards our next phase: a major update to address ease-of-use and add automatic identification for most joysticks and controllers. We’ll be posting some polls on the community site to get backer feedback on what changes are most wanted.
This new update is a major overhaul, so it’s going to take several months to complete. However, once it’s done, we’ll start selling the Replay again. For now, we've suspended sales so we could focus on our current customers. Of course, all backers will be updated to the latest software version at no charge.

There are several Dream Arcades in employee break rooms across Amazon campuses. So a while ago we called the facilities people we've worked with on those orders and asked if there's any chance they could help us with the shipping issue.
It's not the kind of thing they normally work on so it took a bit, but one of them has given us a work around to get these orders shipped. It's a manual process, so it's going to take some effort to get all of them done, but on the orders that we can, we're paying for expedited shipping (some may be too far along in the process to change them to expedited).

updates.update_userinfo: Stuck Amazon Orders are Moving & New Replay Patch
updates.update_content:
There's 233 Replays that Amazon still hasn't shipped. Today I spent two hours on the phone with Amazon to figure out why some of the orders still haven't shipped. If have a couple free hours and you'd like to listen to the call (hold music and all), you can do so here (http://www.dreamcade.com/temp/Record_0042.wav). Sort answer is, something is definitely wrong--they don't know what, but they promise to get back to me right away (which they've promised many times before, but have never followed through).
We are now looking into the possibility of canceling as many of the remaining orders as possible, and shipping them ourselves. The issue with this is that many of them seem to be stuck in "Amazon Limbo" and we aren't sure we can get them returned in a timely fashion. Without getting many of these returned we won't have enough Replays, controllers, & accessories to ship the remaining orders. Over the next couple of days we are going to see how many we need to get back and how long that will take, to enable us to ship them directly from our office. Once we figure out the best way to get the remaining 233 orders sent out, we'll post another update (probably early next week).

Short version of the shipping update is that almost everything is packed and shipped, but orders that were sent through Amazon are still taking a frightfully long time.

Here's the long version:
I've been told by Amazon they don't know why our packages are taking so long to ship and that they are investigating it--even the expedited orders which should take 24-48 hours are taking weeks. As of this morning Amazon has shipped 763 orders.

Amazon is great at delivering your purchases in 2 days or less. But, for third-party orders their performance is turning out to be much slower. We’ve shipped 1,322 orders to Amazon so far (leaving 320 Replay orders left for us to send).
However, once they get to Amazon’s warehouse, they aren’t shipping out to backers anywhere near as quickly as we thought. Amazon has delivered just over 300 hundred of the orders so far. A big part of the reason is that they are internally reshipping some of the orders to different warehouses and--here's the kicker--they say that this process could take up to 3 weeks!

The container arrived Tuesday and we've already packed and shipped 2 large pallets to Amazon late last week. As soon as they get them they'll start shipping them to customers, that should be in the next day or two.

Short version:
Vessel with the container has arrived and the Replays are scheduled to be delivered by next Tuesday. At which point we’ll need to re-pack them per Amazon’s requirements before they are shipped out. The wait is almost over.
Oh, and be sure to check out the early reviews at the bottom of this post.  
Long version:
The vessel arrived in San Francisco (port of Oakland) Monday as expected. However, it will not arrive at our factory until Monday afternoon or Tuesday. This is due to the Fourth of July Holiday, as well as bad luck (our container was offloaded to a warehouse that was backed up before the Holiday).

campaign.story:
Close up of some polished Grill Pinz with laser applied logo's, the production Pinz will have a stamped logo and satin finish
 Grill Pinz are Patent-pending and have several trademark applications submitted for approval to the USPTO
Two sets of Grill Pinz with prototype packages, the full color recipe booklet, and our Oak Grill Scraper
  Team Grill Pinz on the day of our video shoot in a random field in Central NC :) Go Pack!
  Grill Pinz are the result of a 2 year project to eliminate the shortcomings and hazards of using toothpicks on the grill. The design you see today has safety, functionality, and aesthetics as the main considerations, in that order. 
** Limited Edition polished Grill Pin, production Pinz will have a stamped logo and satin finish
Once you hold Grill Pinz you will see and feel the craftsmanship and attention to detail that went into the design. 
This is a premium product that not only looks cool but feels good in the hand. 
Example of the recipes in the recipe booklet included with each set of Grill Pinz, and also on our website Grillpinz.com
We are not exaggerating when we say... "with a few simple ingredients you can make some of the best food you have ever made on the grill".
In fact we would argue that our bacon wrapped chicken cordon-bleu recipe is as good as anything you can make on the grill and could put you and your loved ones into a food coma. 
Not a real coma, just the food type.
     One set of Grill Pinz with the optional Oak Storage Block
 Pictured above is the Oak Storage Block which comes with the gift sets and also in a separate $25 pledge level. The block will be a more durable way to store your Grill Pinz and keep them all together in a drawer. These are hand made by the team and exclusive to our early supporters! 
Team Grill Pinz Oak Grill Scraper
 For the gift sets we are including our Oak Grill Scraper pictured above. These grill scrapers work great to clean your grill surface before and after grilling. They are a natural alternative and a solution to the problem of possible wire bristles being shed by typical grill brushes or the plastic residue that can be left on your grill with synthetic bristle brushes. More information on this can be found at: 
http://www.cbsnews.com/news/grill-barbecue-metal-brush-dangers/
  Grill Pinz exclusive grill apron, available with the gift set support levels
Also included in the Deluxe Gift Set will be a custom grill apron that we are having made for this campaign. This is just an example, the pattern we are looking at is nicer, and will have our logo as well. 
These aprons are made in the USA and come out of Charlotte NC, and we are excited to have the opportunity to work with the fine organization below that helps train and employ people in various trades.   
Please visit Upcyclelife for more information on the awesome work they are doing!
 Grill Pinz were recently reviewed at the blog below: 
Grill Pinz review and great BBQ Blog!
  Our video was produced by Mike with Coign Studio, please contact him for any video work needs, he's a great guy to work with!

campaign.story:
Polygons folds to whatever size you need depending on the way you pick it up. 
Premarked areas on both spoon sizes (tablespoon and teaspoon) let you know where to pick up from to measure the volume required for your recipe.
Practicality and simplicity at its finest.
Back to what makes Polygons awesome...
 ...and a few more
Both sizes have the unique 4-in-1 design, which makes it easier to find the measurement you need in a pinch (no pun intended).
When you back Polygons, you will receive a set that includes both the teaspoon and tablespoon measurements. 
  Does your kitchen drawer look like this?
The average tablespoon set comes with 4-8 different sizes tethered to each other with a ring, and if these spoons get untethered, you can kiss finding the one you need goodbye. 
...and we're being lenient. Those are 5 of the regular spoon sizes pictured against 8 of ours :)
With Polygons, you are able to find the size you need in seconds, without searching through all of your drawers. Plus, the spoon lays completely flat until you need to use it.
When designing Polygons, we wanted to focus on making our product not only durable but also better for the environment than traditional measuring spoons.  
The hinges of Polygons are made of TPR, which have the property of being able to flex a 100,000 cycles without failure.
(Edit: Many of you have messaged us asking for a 10 year warranty card... The life of such a composite plastic product depends on a variety of factors such as usage patterns, abrasion, temperature, humidity, product abuse, etc, other than just the number of times it’s hinges can flex
The product may not live till 10 years, or it might even probably far surpass it
It would be like determining the lifespan of a person based on how well his/her joints function)
Additionally, with the 4-in-1 design, Polygons eliminates the need for excess plastic and metals that traditional measuring spoons use.
The materials we use to create Polygons ensure all ingredients fall off the spoon with little effort. They ensure that the ingredients you use do not stain or stink up your Polygons measuring spoons.

(The images showing the folded spoon resting in place without being held by a hand, are staged photographs... But we see that people want some facility to be able to hold the shape in place without having to hold it, and we're working on it! - covered in the November 17th update)
 A sneak peek of our early prototyping processes 
Numerous configurations & geometries were tested using paper during the ideation stage, then manually tested with a variety of materials
3D volumetric determination & construction 
We tested several manufacturing methods to see which one would be optimal for a product of this nature
Shown in this video is one of these early methods, with very basic tooling without any fineness
Pictured in the campaign video is a prototype with similar functioning to the production version -
 (thickness & features exaggerated for explanation)
The production version has a similar appearance from the top, and the hinges slightly wider at the bottom, for the softer, flexible TPR to have surface area for a robust bonding
This is what gives the product an almost flat, easy-to clean surface both at the top and bottom

We haven’t pictured the nitty-gritties and manufacturing technique of the production version in more excruciating detail to protect our IP, exactly due to instances like these, which we’ve been citing as a concern early on:
https://www.alibaba.com/product-detail/new-design-cheap-Polygons-The-Flat_60551273844.html

Apparently, what you’ve pledge $10+ for, is available for 1/100th the price 
Or is it? The particular seller has listed other popular products on Kickstarter as well, stealing the same images 
You place a bulk advance order, and then never receive anything (we tried it out with this guy)

Polygons was created in 2014 by Rahul Agarwal. An India native, Agarwal is an inventor, designer and teacher.
He's worked on products ranging from the simplest of stationery to complex, head-up display systems.
A few years ago, as a design student at a renowned Indian university, he was given this advice by a senior – “Do not tackle designs that have reached the final stage of their evolution. For example, a spoon.” From that point on, Agarwal dedicated his efforts to reinventing the wheel when it came to this object, and the idea for Polygons was born. After extensively testing with various shapes and materials, he arrived at an optimal geometry.
Over the past couple years, Polygons has won various design awards and thousands have expressed interest in the invention. For the inventor in Agarwal, there could be no greater satisfaction than to see people using what he had created, so he got to task.
Please help us spread the word :)
The larger the Polygons community, the better it'll help us make the best kitchen gadget ever!
 A big BIG shoutout to Tali, for the delicious photographs
http://www.talidovrat.com

And the friends, family, loved ones and kind strangers who've helped us make this happen :)

And also...
...
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
If you like the product, the only risk you're bearing is that of missing out on a true piece of delight by not backing it!
No but seriously, as with any new project, there are always some risks associated with manufacturing and supply chain logistics. We are working with an incredible manufacturing partner and feel confident in the work they will produce for our backers. We understand the unique challenges that come with our type of our product and are familiar with how to avoid and mitigate any issues that arise.
The video features a part-machine, part-manually made prototype, so you can be rest assured that what'll reach your doorstep will be a much, much better product.
During the campaign, there might be some feedback from you, the backers, which we'd want to incorporate in the product we ship.
Based on the feasibility and general consensus about these feedbacks, the process of incorporating them might require a little extra time, all in the interest of delivering the most ultimate kitchen gadget ever :D
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Le’ Cook is a one piece Silicone Spoonula with a “HOOK”
A "Spoonula" is 50% spoon and 50% spatula - and 100% useful around your kitchen for mixing, serving, scraping, flipping and cooking.
Rewards
    Cool Le' Cook short video to share so we can reach more stretch goal for more colors
   What makes Le’ Cook different from all other Spoonulas out there is our 'L' shape hook that we designed to allow you to rest and hang your Spoonula on the edge of your frying pan with ease while you cook. You will never have to spare a second thought of where to rest your saucy spatula when you need to free up your hands or walk away for a second to season your cooking.
                 Features

'L' HOOK DESIGN - Our one of a kind hook design at the bottom of our product will give you a brand new and simplified cooking experience. The 'L' Hook design can attach our Spoonula on the edge of your pan with ease. 
ERGONOMIC EASY-TO-CLEAN SEAMLESS ONE-PIECE SMOOTH DESIGN - Le'Cook's Non-porous material means no seams or cracks to trap food and bacteria - these utensils clean up easy and stay that way. It is stain-resistant, and also dishwasher safe for easy cleaning. 
BEAUTIFULLY DESIGNED FLEXIBLE EDGE - Will not scratch or damage surfaces of nonstick or enamel cookware. 
SOFT GRIP NON-SLIP SATIN TEXTURE FINISH - The velvety finish design on these utensils also provide superior grip and easy no-slip handling. 
INTERNAL NYLON HANDLE SUPPORT TECHNOLOGY - The lightweight nylon core makes this Spoonula easy to handle for all simple home cooked meals. 
HIGH HEAT 450°F PRO-GRADE SILICONE – High quality silicone material can take heat up to 450°F (your hands might not, so please use caution or oven mitts in such a scenario). Safe for Coated & Non-stick Cookware, perfect for use with hot foods, and safe while in contact with hot frying pans that are still on the burner. 
FDA APPROVED AND BPA FREE - High quality silicone material. Hygienic and hypoallergenic with no open pores. Nonstick silicone body is easily cleaned, without staining or accumulating odors.
Size: L 11.75" x W 2.2" x H 1"  
Weight: 2.9 oz/ 80g
Quality and Function
The Material  
We've given much thought and put in great care into the design of Le'Cook from the inside and out. After rigorous research we found that the best internal structure/core for our Spoonula is Nylon material. Originally we had our heart set on stainless steel for its strength and durability; however, it was too heavy, absorbed too much heat, and was too bendable - not very practical attributes to serve our purposes. We decided that the nylon core is most suitable for our needs of creating a lightweight and easy to handle kitchen utensil. It also didn't absorb as much heat as other materials, which is ideal for our product.
As for the exterior, through further trials and error we ultimately decided that Silicone would be the best option for Le' Cook. The material is so flexible and easy to clean. You can gently yet effectively scrap anything from your frying pan without leaving any scratches on the surface.
 Why you need our spoonula
Wooden cooking tools can burn easily when rested too long on the side of a heated cooking pan. It tends to scratch the surface of cooking pan when you try to scrape the leftovers from the bottom. 
Steel cooking tools can easily become scorching hot when left in contact with the surface of a heated pan for too long. Similarly, this material will easily leave scratch marks the surface of most cooking pans. 
Nylon cooking tools tend to melt when they reach certain temperatures if rested on the edge of your heated pan. Nylon material is also quite fragile and easy to chip.
 Functionality & Versatility of the "L" Hook  
The 'L' Hook was designed with an idea of facing gravity - the weight of the handle will help this Spoonula balance to the side of your cooking pan with ease as the hook secures to edge. We tested Le' Cook with a variety of cooking pans and pots, and it works beautifully. Le' Cook Hook work best with a 90° edge angle cooking pan.
Timeline
Stretch Goals 
 We will unlock new color options for each stretch goal reached!
Colors for the actual Spoonula may vary slightly from the tones shown on the computer screen.
The Story and Idea
I love cooking and experimenting with recipes almost every day. As I was preparing dinner one evening, the usual problem arose when it came time for me to season and spice up my dishes - I didn't know where to rest my saucy spatula.
That is when I start looking online for spoon rests and spatula holders. I ended up loving the idea of pan spatula holders - the moment I saw that product and how easily it clips to the side of your pans, I bought it without a second thought. However, this product still takes up room and needs to be cleaned separately after each use… “I wish there was a utensil that combines the pan spatula holder and the spatula itself - that would be amazing” ...the thought hit me!
Pan Spatula holder + Spoonula = Le' Cook Spoonula
That was me about a year ago. From that day I made a lot of sketches and drawings trying to combine both cooking spatula and pan spatula holder into one solid high quality product, and that is when the idea of Le’ Cook Spoonula was born!

campaign.story:
Le’ Cook is a one piece Silicone Spoonula with a “HOOK”
Relaunch link :https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/rintik/le-cook-cooking-spoonula-with-a-hook
A "Spoonula" is 50% spoon and 50% spatula - and 100% useful around your kitchen for mixing, serving, scraping, flipping and cooking.
Le' Cook in action :)
What makes Le’ Cook different from all other Spoonulas out there is our 'L' shape hook that we designed to allow you to rest and hang your Spoonula on the edge of your frying pan with ease while you cook. You will never have to spare a second thought of where to rest your saucy spatula when you need to free up your hands or walk away for a second to season your cooking.
     Features


'L' HOOK DESIGN - Our one of a kind hook design at the bottom of our product will give you a brand new and simplified cooking experience. The 'L' Hook design can attach our Spoonula on the edge of your pan with ease.
ERGONOMIC EASY-TO-CLEAN SEAMLESS ONE-PIECE SMOOTH DESIGN - Le'Cook's Non-porous material means no seams or cracks to trap food and bacteria - these utensils clean up easy and stay that way.  It is stain-resistant, and also dishwasher safe for easy cleaning.
BEAUTIFULLY DESIGNED FLEXIBLE EDGE - Will not scratch or damage surfaces of nonstick or enamel cookware.
SOFT GRIP NON-SLIP SATIN TEXTURE FINISH - The velvety finish design on these utensils also provide superior grip and easy no-slip handling.
INTERNAL NYLON HANDLE SUPPORT TECHNOLOGY - The lightweight nylon core makes this Spoonula easy to handle for all simple home cooked meals. 
HIGH HEAT 450°F PRO-GRADE SILICONE – High quality silicone material can take heat up to 450°F (your hands might not, so please use caution or oven mitts in such a scenario). Safe for Coated & Non-stick Cookware, perfect for use with hot foods, and safe while in contact with hot frying pans that are still on the burner. 
FDA APPROVED AND BPA FREE - High quality silicone material. Hygienic and hypoallergenic with no open pores. Nonstick silicone body is easily cleaned, without staining or accumulating odors.
Size: L 11.75" x W 2.2" x H 1"
Weight: 2.9 oz/ 80g


Quality and Function
The Material 
We've given much thought and put in great care into the design of Le'Cook from the inside and out.  After rigorous research we found that the best internal structure/core for our Spoonula is Nylon material. Originally we had our heart set on stainless steel for its strength and durability; however, it was too heavy, absorbed too much heat, and was too bendable - not very practical attributes to serve our purposes. We decided that the nylon core is most suitable for our needs of creating a lightweight and easy to handle kitchen utensil. It also didn't absorb as much heat as other materials, which is ideal for our product. 
As for the exterior, through further trials and error we ultimately decided that Silicone would be the best option for Le' Cook. The material is so flexible and easy to clean. You can gently yet effectively scrap anything from your frying pan without leaving any scratches on the surface.


Why you need our spoonula
Wooden cooking tools can burn easily when rested too long on the side of a heated cooking pan. It tends to scratch the surface of cooking pan when you try to scrape the leftovers from the bottom.
Steel cooking tools can easily become scorching hot when left in contact with the surface of a heated pan for too long. Similarly, this material will easily leave scratch marks the surface of most cooking pans. 
Nylon cooking tools tend to melt when they reach certain temperatures if rested on the edge of your heated pan. Nylon material is also quite fragile and easy to chip.
  Functionality & Versatility of the "L" Hook 
The 'L' Hook was designed with an idea of facing gravity - the weight of the handle will help this Spoonula balance to the side of your cooking pan with ease as the hook secures to edge.  We tested Le' Cook with a variety of cooking pans and pots, and it works beautifully. Le' Cook Hook work best with a 90° edge angle cooking pan.
  Rewards
Le' Cook Apron
Be sure to treat yourself or the family chef to our full coverage aprons as well. The Le' Cook Apron is made from 50% Polyester and 50% Cotton. The thick fabric is machine washable and easy to clean.  With an adjustable neck strap, ties long enough to be tied in front, and 3 spacious front pockets, this apron will be a perfect addition to your kitchen.
2 Color Options
 Pledge options
Click here, like our Facebook page & Share our post to redeem your Facebook only combo pack!
           Timeline
Stretch Goals 
We will unlock new color options for each stretch goal reached!
Colors for the actual Spoonula may vary slightly from the tones shown on the computer screen.
The Story and Idea  
I love cooking and experimenting with recipes almost every day. As I was preparing dinner one evening, the usual problem arose when it came time for me to season and spice up my dishes - I didn't know where to rest my saucy spatula.
That is when I start looking online for spoon rests and spatula holders. I ended up loving the idea of pan spatula holders - the moment I saw that product and how easily it clips to the side of your pans, I bought it without a second thought. However, this product still takes up room and needs to be cleaned separately after each use… “I wish there was a utensil that combines the pan spatula holder and the spatula itself - that would be amazing” ...the thought hit me!
Pan Spatula holder + Spoonula = Le' Cook Spoonula
That was me about a year ago. From that day I made a lot of sketches and drawings trying to combine both cooking spatula and pan spatula holder into one solid high quality product, and that is when the idea of Le’ Cook Spoonula was born!
We have designed and printed a 3D prototype. Shortly after we produced a sample and tested the mock up in our kitchen to make sure the functionality of the hook and the material meets our standards.
How you can help us reach our goal?  By selecting any one of our rewards we offer so we can start the manufacturing process for Le' Cook and meet the required minimum order quantities. 
More shapes and designs are coming in our next campaign, please let us know what kind of cooking utensils you'd like to see the 'L' hook on the most! :)
MEDIA
If you are interested to write something about us, feel free to contact us anytime via email LeCookproducts@gmail.com
We will provide a Dropbox link to our image gallery, thank you
.

campaign.story:
We exist because these exist:
Free Collar Supports
#laundrysafe #hasslefree #problemsolved
INTRODUCING - SolidStays™
Fits over 90% of all Collar Pockets
  Every problem is an opportunity for improvement.
SolidStays™ was created to resolve a relatively small but persistent problem I was having with collar stays at home. 
I don't recall exactly when I decided to take the first step, but I believe it was from one of my "treadmill brain" moments.  When running, I try to keep my mind off of the monotony by thinking of problems.  Both my wife and I had recently complained to each other about collar stays.  She was complaining about finding them everywhere and I was complaining about never finding them(the key to any great marriage is communication).  A couple more treadmill sessions later and I was ready to go to the whiteboard.  Having done some initial research and confirming the lack of existing IP, I met up with my friend Eric in February and pitched him the concept.  Eric was very familiar with the issue and was up for the challenge, so we got right to work.
Design and Development
We started the project by defining our functional requirements, then working through material and design details in creating our initial concepts.  We launched our product development leveraging our MakerBot™ Rep 2X to 3D print and validate different design options.
Further refinement through functional testing:
 Final evaluations to complete our design and move on to material selection:
Water Jetted Prototypes
In order to complete our design, we needed to move away from 3D printed plastic and leverage production intent material for our product validations.  
Water Jetted Prototypes
Refinement/Validation - Yahtzee!
A few minor tweaks along with additional endurance testing - 
our Patent Pending design was complete and SolidStays™ was ready for Kickstarter. Our original SolidStays™ comes in the standard 2.5" length, with a body width of 0.385". These will fit the majority of all shirts. There are some instances where you may want to trim the back of the SolidStays™ to tailor the fit to a shorter pocket. They wont fall out, so your good to go!
Patent Pending

campaign.story:
Once our Kickstarter campaign ends we'll still be taking orders on our website HERE.
Have you ever used a power strip, plug adapter or extension cord?   Why? Not enough plugs where and when you needed them? 
Today's solutions for this problem are to rewire your home, hire an electrician to install more outlets, cut sheet-rock, spackle and paint, use bulky solutions like power strips, or unplug and re-plug constantly. These are just mediocre solutions that we've all come to accept.
NOT ANYMORE, in just 5 minutes you can install theOUTlet and always have extra outlets at your fingertips. theOUTlet can double or even triple the number of outlets in your home; hidden until you need them. Open the Possibilities...
theOUTlet with 2 USB Ports is now AVAILABLE!!!! 
With a quick and easy installation that fits into a standard electrical box, theOUTlet is always there for you, functioning exactly like a “normal” outlet. Then, when you need more outlets just Open the Possibilities with the simple push of a button, instantly doubling the amount of outlets; where you need them, when you need them.
theOUTlet can be installed in any orientation to fit your needs or use location. Opening to the left, right, or even vertically for baseboard applications.
Installation is extremely easy. There are three simple color coded screws as well as text to guide you through the process. Not only clearly labeled live, neutral, and ground connections but also white, black and green text for the wire colors. It just doesn't get any easier to install. 
theOUTlet also includes Tamper Resistant features built into the housing. This means there's no need for these annoying things anymore!
The basic 15 amp versions are designed for the home. 20 Amp and GFCI versions are being designed for the garage and outside the home. But, concepts are in the works for industrial and commercial applications as well. Imagine theOUTlet in every Airport, Train Station and Office Building. The applications are endless.
If you are anything like us, you are always looking for that point of differentiation that you can supply to your customer. Imagine being able to double the amount of outlets in your customer's home without using large boxes or chasing new wires. Offering your customer a unique and elegant solution to proactively address their needs. In their bedroom, in their office, under their bay window. Anywhere in their home they need more outlets but don't want to chase new wires or cut sheet rock.
Click to go to our Testimonials page where we have all the links
    Engineering is complete, multiple utility patents are filed (PCT), Safety Certification is Pending, and manufacturing is established. We have the solution, the experience, the expertise, the passion, and the determination. All we need now is your support. Be the first to fund the hottest new product to hit the market since sliced bread.
We have a very robust product pipeline already under development. We have chosen to focus our resources for launch however, on the basic 4 plug product and the 2/USB stretch goal. Other products under development are listed below. So yes, we will have that version too.
theOUTlet with 2 USB's is NOW unlocked, upgrade TODAY.
For only $7 each, we will include two USB ports into the product for stretch goal #1. Or, you can back the new USB tier as well. See our project update for further details. 
You may or may not know that all USB ports are not created equal. Ever plugged in your tablet only to see a message that this device is not supported? Or your device is not charging? Here's a great article explaining how USB ports are actually designed to charge at different rates: http://www.wired.com/2013/12/charging-devices-faq/. The USB ports we're including are individually capable of charging at 2 Amps (2000 mA). But if you plug things into both of the USB ports, they'll share that max power and each device will charge at less than 2 Amps. In General, we can charge one tablet or two phones.
Why did we design the product this way? In fairness, we did it because of the constraints with the size of our product. As you can imagine we've fit a lot of things into a tiny footprint inside your wall (4 plugs and 2 USB's where there's normally only 2 plugs)! One of our goals from the beginning of the project was to retrofit into as many electrical boxes as possible to make installation as convenient as we could. In future versions we could make the product slightly larger (requiring a larger wall box) and increase the capacity of the USB's. 
Help us reach $55k in Funding to unlock Stretch Goal #2  (Colors)  
We know that all outlets in all homes aren't white, so at no extra cost to you, we think we should have some color options. You can see some colors in the below image that we know are common in the big box hardware stores. But we want to hear from all of you about the colors you think make sense for your product. So at the end of the project, and once we've unlocked this stretch goal, we're going to send out a survey to see which top 3 colors people want and those are the ones we'll make available. 
We've signed up with BackerKit to make sure we deliver your products in the most effective manner!
We are the type of people that represent why Kickstarter was founded. A small start up company with a great idea and a BIG dream of sharing our solution with the world. No big corporation, no hidden agendas, no corporate financing, no massive infrastructure or stock holders to answer to. Just two family men that have the needed expertise, with an evolutionary product, that can and will improve people's lives.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We aren't going to sit here and say there are no risks. Major corporations fail to bring projects to market from time to time. So yes it's a possibility that our product may run into road blocks, launch late, have compromised features from what we expected, etc...Kickstarter recently had an analysis of their fulfillment success rates done by the University of Pennsylvania and they found that roughly 10% of projects on Kickstarter fail to deliver, which is impressively low. You can read the report by clicking the link at the end of this section. 

What makes us believe that we'll be in the 90% successful delivery group? This is where our experience and dedication come in. We've been in the consumer packaged goods industry for a long time, seen success and failure many times, know what to do and what to watch out for. With your support behind us we feel like we could conquer the world (and oh yea, launch theOUTlet)!!

https://www.kickstarter.com/fulfillment
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hello Backers! 

We wanted to share news that theOUTlet is officially available on Amazon.com and Lowes.com. We're working with additional retailers to continue to gain placement as well. This is of course exciting for us and is an important next step with "kickstarting" our business.

Hello Backers!
Believe it or not the wait is over... theOUTlet is officially being shipped to all of our backers! Shipping started on Friday and will be complete later today. Once we have all tracking info we will send out via BackerKit. That being said, we've already gotten confirmation from several backers that they have received their orders and are thrilled with how they came out (images below).
We realize that the timeline for delivery of theOUTlet was a little longer...ok A LOT longer...than what we were originally shooting for. We sincerely appreciate the amount of patience and support you have all shown. We've learned quite a bit about being a startup company and some of the challenges that larger companies may not face on a daily basis.

Hello Backers!
The day we've all been waiting for is right around the corner now. We are officially in production with theOUTlet and that much closer to getting them into your hands! 
We have 7,500 units in production now which is the negotiated Minimum Order Quantity (MOQ) with our factory. The factory is targeting having all units ready to ship from their facility and loaded into shipping containers by the end of the month. Then the product will be in the supply chain process for roughly 30 days. At that point all that has to happen is sorting and shipping them from our US distribution center (DC) to all of our backers. The company we've hired as our supply chain partner will manage the entire process from picking product up at the factory to storing in their US DC, to getting them to your individual door steps. So we aren't packing and shipping these out of our garages :)

campaign.story:
Wide, Ventilated, Waterproof, Quick-release straps
for Pebble Time and Pebble Time Steel
We love Pebble.
Have since the beginning. Two years ago, we designed WIDE BODY, the first silicone strap built specifically for the original Pebble. We launched it right here on Kickstarter. And last year, we introduced SHANK for Pebble Steel. Our simple goal with our watch straps was to make Pebble smart watches look great and work great. Now we’re doing it again with HAMMER.
Design
HAMMER is wider. The HAMMER strap is 28 mm wide. Time’s stock straps are 22 mm wide. We were able to fit the wider HAMMER on Time by designing a couple of notches into our straps. We grew HAMMER wider so that it seems to extend directly from Time’s lugs. Rugged. Sport watch. Solid. Bad-ass. You’ll find your own way to describe it. HAMMER just makes your Time look great.
Features
HAMMER is extremely ventilated. If you run or do anything else that makes you sweat, HAMMER’s vent holes transform Pebble Time into a true sport watch. And on the long side of the strap, some of the vent holes double as buckle holes. Because those buckle holes run all the way up the strap, HAMMER is extraordinarily adjustable. It fits great on both large wrists and small wrists. HAMMER is also waterproof. Run with it. Sweat on it. Wash your hands. Swim! Go nuts.
Materials
HAMMER is made from silicone. Silicone is the same material used on Time’s stock straps, and it is prized for its softness and flexibility. It’s strong, too. The buckle is made from brushed stainless steel. And stainless steel quick-release spring bars allow you to swap straps whenever you feel like it!
Colors
We're going to make HAMMER in five different colors: black, white, red, citrus, and camouflage. Most people choose black. That's just the way it goes. It looks awesome! White is white. Red will match as closely as possible to the color that Pebble uses on their red straps. Citrus is our own vibrant lime color. And camo is just plain bad-ass.
 Here is some video of Pebble Time (in white) and HAMMER (also white).
Kickstarter
Our small product development company, UTENSILE, has worked on smart watches and wearables for some of the biggest brands in the world. But we love to do our own accessory products, like HAMMER, too!
And that’s why we turn to you on Kickstarter. We’ve taken the project through pre-production prototyping. The samples look pretty good, right? Now, to get HAMMER into full production, we need your help.
We know that most people who will back this project are also Pebble Time backers, so you already know how this works. Your pledge will fund our production tooling, assembly, logistics and many of our other product development expenses. In turn, backers will be rewarded with our watch straps.
Here's a side-by-side composite photo (we only have one Pebble Time so far!) that shows HAMMER straps and regular straps. After careful analysis, you should be able to conclude that HAMMER straps are wide, ventilated, and awesome.
Generations
Finally, Check out that photo down there. Those are three generations of straps from all of us at Richard Tracy Brand! From left to right: Wide Body is on the original "OG" Pebble, Shank is on Steel, and HAMMER of course fits on Pebble Time and Pebble Time Steel. I hope you can see that our vision for our products is simple: our straps make your Pebble look awesome.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The video and images on this project page include CAD models, 3D printed prototypes, and pre-production silicone samples because HAMMER isn't in production yet--we need your help to get us there! We'll do our best to exceed your expectations of what silicone straps can look like, but there's always a risk that we might not meet your expectations.

We want you to know that this risk is minimal because we have designed, developed, and produced high quality watch straps many times. This isn’t our first rodeo—we know what we're doing! And if you had a WIDE BODY or SHANK strap for the previous generations of Pebble, then you know that we can deliver the goods.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Kickstarter,
I hope you're still loving your HAMMER straps. Or at least I hope you ONCE loved them!
I just launched a new project, and I think you'll love it, too.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/utensile/tetrafidget-focus-fidget-four
Tetrafidget is a pocket-sized tetrahedron with four sides, eight ways to fidget, and MAGNETS! Use it to unlock new levels of focus and creativity. Or just post notes on the fridge.

Kickstarters,
There has been lots of Pebble news recently. Did you see that big screen on the Pebble Time 2?! And how about that slim new Pebble 2?! Well, I have good news for you. If you backed Pebble's new stuff, know that HAMMER silicone straps work on BOTH of those new models. Yep! If you feel like adding another (or perhaps a new color) HAMMER to your P2 or PT2 collection, you can still get one here: http://www.richardtracybrand.com/products/hammer

Kickstarters,
We didn't get any straps here in the US in August, so no straps were shipped out to you guys in August, either. Kickstarter: amirite?! Seriously though, HAMMER will be coming to you real soon. You may have noticed that we locked-down the address change option at the end of last week, and we intend to start shipping on September 4th. That's Friday!
Color issue: there were not that many of you WHITE strap backers (91 of 1462), but we still love you of course. However, the factory had a problem with the WHITE straps, and those ones are going to be delayed by "a few" weeks.

Kickstarters,
The gears of innovation don't stop turning here at Utensile and Richard Tracy Brand. And because you're a HAMMER backer, I know that you dig our stuff at least on some level! So I hope that you will support our newest Kickstarter project, SLAZER.

Kickstarters,
I checked-in with my counterpart at our silicone supplier's factory on Friday, and she said that they plan to send the first shipment of HAMMER straps this week. The Kickstarter units are traveling by air, so we should get them here in Portland by August 26th. We'll start sending them out right away, so some of you will actually get these things in August like we originally estimated! This is pretty amazing--considering that we re-tooled the molds and scrounged-up new quick-release spring-bars mid-project. That's too many hyphens.

Kickstarters,
We received the production samples from the factory on Friday. I had been waiting for this package with some serious anticipation for two reasons:
1) These samples were the first straps molded from our new multi-cavity production tooling for HAMMER. Everything you've seen before today has come out of a single-cavity prototype tool. The best analogy for the old proto-tool is "custom waffle iron!"

Kickstarters,
We took the white HAMMER straps and a GoPro to our favorite local swimming hole on Saturday. I can only do a half-decent backflip about 50% of the time, so I asked one of the guys at High Rocks to wear my Pebble so that I could be on cameraman detail. The results are insane, and it's all captured in this video.
WARNING:
- There's some NSFW strong language in the video, and
- you'll probably want to get white HAMMER straps, so
- enjoy SUMMER! Here it is:

Kickstarters,
The HAMMER color samples arrived today.
These samples are still molded from the prototype tool, so the chamfers and rounds and other design details aren't as "crisp" as they'll appear on the production straps, but the straps still look pretty damned awesome.

Kickstarters,
Well, HAMMER crossed the goal line in less than a week, and we’ve got three weeks to go! Yee-hah! Woo-hoo! Celebration noise! This is outstanding news, and of course we couldn’t have done it without your support.
I don’t have the actual color samples in hand yet, but our supplier sent this photo last night. They’re concerned that the red isn’t matched yet and that the blend on the camo isn’t good enough. And they’re right! While like this (that’s why we ask for actual samples via FedEx), you should be able to tell that the camo is too “busy.”
