campaign.story:
You know how creative people use whiteboards to generate cool amazing ideas? What if we were to tell you that we've taken that whiteboard experience and converted into a notebook that helps you generate great ideas where ever you go! Not only that, but you'll never have to waste a single sheet of paper ever again when you have a half baked idea you just want to scribble down somewhere. We call this product the Wipebook and we think it may just be the last notebook you ever buy! Check out Wipebook.com for more info!
We've spent the last few months developing our newest dry erase film that we call Hypergloss. This new film makes the erasing and reusing the Wipebook a significant improvement on previous versions. The goal of this Kickstarter is not only to update the Wipebook with our new Hypergloss film, but we also want to test out new variants of our products with real time feedback from backers like you. 
 Our last Kickstarter was a fantastic opportunity to get constant feedback and develop great products and we're hoping to create a similar collaborative environment again. Here is what we are launching:
Format: Case Bound with Hard Cover
Page Quantity: 24 Hypergloss dry erase pages
Size: A5 format (5.875" x 8.25")
Recommended Markers: Staedtler Correctable or Dry erase markers
Description: Wipebook 3 is the latest and greatest Wipebook. This Wipebook is case bound and includes a completely new film, giving this book a beautiful look and feel. Not only that, but the Wipebook 3 Hypergloss film makes writing incredibly smooth and clean. Best of all, erasing is much MUCH easier than before. This is important because if you want to reuse a Wipebook over, and over again, the easier it is to erase the better it is. However, if the pages are too erasable, the writing may smudge between the pages. This is why the case binding is used to keep the pages tightly bounded together.
Just add 5$ to your reward to receive a workbook of your choice! ( you can add as many as you wish, just add 5$ for every extra book)
Format: Saddle Stitched Workbook
Pages: 4 Hypergloss dry erase pages
Size: Letter format 8.5" x 11" OR A5 format (mini)
Recommended Markers: Staedtler Correctable or Dry erase markers  
Description: These simple 4 page workbooks are ideal if you need a very lightweight work area to brainstorm, generate ideas or solve problems. They are saddle stitched in place and come in 4 different variants ( mini, ruled, grid and blank)
Format:  Detachable ProClick binding with 40pt hardcover
Pages: 25 Hypergloss dry erase pages
Size: Letter format (8.5" x 11")
Recommended Markers: Staedtler Correctable or Dry erase markers
Description: A lot of people enjoyed the form factor of Wipebook 2, with its large pages and detachable binding, so we've decided to keep this form factor while improving the erasable film to our new Hypergloss formula. Pages are 8.5 x 11 and the book includes 25 pages (50 sides).
Size: Letter format (8.5" x 11")
Description: To give your Wipebook 2 the same look and feel as Wipebook 3, we are introducing a new accessory for Wipebook 2 called the Wipebook Folio. The Folio protects your Wipebook, detachable binding and gives it a sleek new look and feel.
Format: Pack of 10 unpunched pages
Pages: 10 unpunched Hypergloss dry erase pages
Size: Letter format (8.5" x 11")
Recommended Markers: Staedtler Correctable or Dry erase markers
Description: Wipebook Paper is the most economical way to get that Wipebook writing experience. Instead of binding the pages, we give you individual pages that you can punch in whatever binding system you currently use. Pages are 8.5 x 11 and are made of our Hypergloss film.
Luckily we have been able to work with 3 different manufacturers to produce Wipebooks in order to mitigate quality control risks. The technologies used can be found in many large scale printing facilities, and our patented UV formula is applied on different stocks of paper. 
Manufacturing can normally be done with a 2-3 week lead time for production. Luckily we've already run a full batch of products ahead of time to iron out the manufacturing kinks. Production also has all of our digital files in advance. It really is just a matter of pressing the big red GO button.
                                                                                                        Frank Bouchard: Frank is the creative torque of the duo, initially came up with the Wipebook prototype. He completed his Masters in Engineering Management  at the University of Ottawa while working full-time for the school’s Adventures In Engineering program. The final Wipebook product “feel” was heavily influenced by his laid-back, easy-going attitude. Team Wipebook really hopes that you can enjoy the smooth flow of the marker on the wipebook's pages as much as he does.
Toby Maurice: Although he may be the old man of the team, Toby is definitely a man child at heart with endless energy. Toby holds a Bachelor of Engineering in Electrical Engineering from Carleton University as well as a Bachelor of Applied Science in Chemical Engineering and a Masters in Engineering Management from the University of Ottawa. He is Team Wipebook's Logistic's master, handling everything from getting patents in 3 months (record time!), trade marks and keeping the books straight.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The first Kickstarter was full of challenges and issues but we've learnt so much from that experience. We feel more prepared since we have our infrastructure for shipping and manufacturing figured out ahead of the campaign. That being said, there are always challenges, and here is a list of a few that we could potentially encounter: 

Integration:
Managing data and orders is always complicated when you deal with high volume especially with multiple products that have multiple variants. This time around, we will be integrating Kickstarter orders with our existing e-commerce infrastructure to streamline the data management. This should avoid juggling csv's all over the place and mixing up orders.

Production:
Since the first Kickstarter, we've manufactured Wipebooks with 3 separate printing and glossing facilities to mitigate risk if there are quality issues or pricing issues. Having fallback manufacturers is especially important if we plan to fulfill these quickly. We also plan to print a smaller sample set of books mi-campaign in order mitigate quality issues. If these sample batches are good, we may see some rewards shipping out as soon as the campaign is completed.

Shipping Delays:
This is most likely one of the biggest challenges. Our shipping provider is preparing for volume shipments ahead of time if ever we reach similar volumes to our first Kickstarter. Our e-commerce platform is also integrated directly with our pick and pack facility, which should avoid having to manually send data, which is always risky. 

International Shipments & Lost Orders:
International backers beware. The biggest issues we've faced is international shipping. We've had issues with customs and lost packages when we started shipping around the world. This will be mitigated by focusing our efforts on Canada, the US and the EU. Once these are shipped, we will move on to international orders outside of these zones so we can monitor these shipments carefully. We are also trying a new shipping solution for international shipments that should ship within a few days, instead of relying on the regular postal service.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Pre-order on Nomiku.com
Our Kickstarter is almost over! If you missed it, visit nomiku.com to pre-order the new Nomiku.
Click to view Nomiku press
      Hello! Meet the new Nomiku.
Main Street eateries, Michelin three-star restaurants, and most everywhere in between have been dazzling diners with their sous vide creations for years, cooking vacuum-sealed food in a controlled low-temperature water bath that yields perfect results every single time.
Sous vide may sound complicated, but it's all about exact temperature control. No cooking appliance puts you more in control than Nomiku.
The new Nomiku is more powerful and smaller than the first generation – a single-bodied machine that now clips onto the front of a pot you already own for easy access.
There's a sleek single knob to turn and control the temperature and a larger touch screen.
Using our Tender app, anyone can create, share, and send sous vide recipes with the time and temperature directly to their radically redesigned Nomiku. 
The Tender App
Think of our new Tender iOS/Android app as your sous chef…
Now anyone can take Top Chef Masters' Chris Cosentino's Sous Vide Ribs or Chef Hugh Acheson's Sous Vide Halibut recipe and make it their own.
Bring the power of top chefs, scientists, and passionate homecooks into your kitchen and become part of our vibrant cooking community!
Rewards
 
Meet Makers Who Sous Vide
 

What to Make with Nomiku
Explore our creative community for inspiration! We're there for you on our app Tender, Facebook, Instagram, Tumblr, Twitter, and Pinterest.
Eggs are a great first Nomiku experience, the eggs come self contained so there's no need for a bag. You can drop them in at 64ºC (147ºF) and then walk away.
After an hour egg yolks are perfectly custardy and whites are gorgeously silky. Have dozens of eggs all ready to go at the same time for a brunch party or store them in the fridge for later and reheat in the same pot! 
We release guided recipes weekly on our blog and social networks. Now you can access them all in one place on Tender! Check out how to make the perfect duck.

New Nomiku Specs
Use less water: the minimum water level is now 1.5". This means you can worry less about keeping the water between the Min and Max line.
Easy cleaning: Nomiku's bottom is now removable.
Easier access: Nomiku now clips to the front of the pot.
More compact.
Made in the USA!
The new Nomiku is designed in San Francisco and made right here in the Bay Area.

WiFi-Connectivity with Spark Core
We're proud to power the Nomiku with the bleeding edge in WiFi technology. The Kickstarter success Spark keeps getting better through their open-source community.
Because of you...
Restaurant quality food is being made in home kitchens around the world.
Here's what your contribution towards the $200,000 will go to:
Component costs
Warehouse costs
Tooling and mechanical costs
Assembly and testing costs
Our core belief is that everyone can make amazing food; they just need the right tools. You are an integral part of our journey and it would impossible for us to move into the future without doing this together.

With gratitude,
Lisa, Abe, Bam, Patrick, and Monica

Special Thanks
Our original Nomiku Kickstarter Backers
Sprinkle Lab
Jim Eber
Bill and Christine Bumgarner
Harold McGee
Chef Chris Cosentino
Chef Joshua Skenes

Chef Kristen Kish

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In 2012, Nomiku started a sous vide movement right here on Kickstarter. Thousands of people worldwide now can turn a pot of water into a sous vide machine.

There are many moving parts with a hardware project but the major risks and challenges lie in vendors and testing. Third party suppliers may be late in supplying critical components and testing may result in slight design changes. We've been through mass manufacturing before and will do our best to mitigate these bumps in the road through good relationships with trustworthy vendors, and rapid prototyping of design changes. Since we will be manufacturing in the United States we will have tighter control over schedule, assembly, and QC.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
IF YOU MISSED THE KICKSTARTER, WOULD LIKE TO PURCHASE ADDITIONAL ITEMS, OR JUST WANT TO SUPPORT SPICY HORSE, PLEASE CLICK HERE FOR OUR PAYPAL STORE
Check Out the Following Links for Important Updates:
Read the Update about Linux being added to the campaign and Ouya as a stretch goal!
The latest poster by Joey, The Demon Killing Kimono, a $60 Add-on
"Loved American McGee's Alice... one of the few games I had completed at the time. Can't wait to play this!!!" - Richard Garriott
"Love it -- art direction is awesome, sets a whole new bar for Unity games. The blend of traditionally-inspired and manga themes is awesome. Plays just like you'd expect a solid Action RPG to."  - Jon Radoff
“Combine the gorgeous Japanese brush painting style that make Okami so lovely with frenetic arcade action, and you've got Akaneiro: Demon Hunters. I'm looking forward to seeing the latest product from the fertile mind of American McGee." - Ernest W. Adams  
Veteran game designer American McGee (Quake, Alice, Grimm) and Spicy Horse (Alice: Madness Returns) are set on delivering players a uniquely enthralling "buy it all" action role-playing experience. 
Akaneiro: Demon Hunters will transport you to a world realized in a striking visual style inspired by Japanese ink, watercolor and woodblock illustration. We’ve dug deep into the history and folklore of Japan when designing our scenarios and characters. Mixing this foundation with an original mythology inspired by Red Riding Hood yields a fantastic and inspiring setting for players to explore.
Akaneiro provides players with a unique ARPG of depth, blended seamlessly with the speed and intensity of a pure action title. Combat is fast and unrelenting, but you can sway the tide with careful selection of abilities and equipment. A multitude of character building paths are available, though we've avoided being overly prescriptive, ensuring you can find the best balance of abilities and equipment for your personal play style. 
The game world is separated in to Regions, which represent a quadrant of Yomi Island. Each Region contains several Areas, each presenting a different environment style and introducing new enemy and boss types. An area contains several missions, forming a small story arc. 
We want to provide players with an ARPG that doesn't ever end, and doesn't have you waiting around for a year on an expansion that you finish in 2 weeks. After release, we'll strive to push the boundaries of our world further with each passing month. 
Akaneiro has been in development since mid 2011. Our Closed Beta has been running since November 2012. Our target platforms are Windows, Mac OS X, Android/iOS Tablet, and Linux. Both the dedicated PC client & web version will enter open beta in January 2013, and launch to the public as Free-to-Play or "Buy it All" on January 25 . 
Our closed beta has been met with high-praise from players and press, who've greatly enjoyed the level of immersion and captivating environments we've crafted. We've been responding to beta feedback with weekly patches and have added many new features since our beta commenced.
We've been Greenlit! A Steam version will also be available. In celebration, we've added a new $30 Tier with the Spirit Helper Pet, Karakuri Gaben.
We've have managed to take Akaneiro way beyond what we thought originally possible. That has been due to the passion and dedication of a relatively small development team. What's been achieved both artistically and mechanically is fantastic… but it's just not enough to call the game complete, to satisfy our fans or ourselves. 
We desperately want the final form of Akaneiro to represent the great amount time and effort that’s gone toward getting it this far. To finish what we've started and present Akaneiro to our players in a truly final state, we need to deliver our promised features to all target platforms. 
The problem is it's time to launch to PC/MacOS and we feel some key features are missing as well as important platforms. That’s where you come in… 
We need to raise $200,000 to support our current team of developers in realizing the most complete version the game. Listed below you'll find out what we earnestly believe is necessary for Akaneiro to truly become the game we know it can be. 
Your backing will guarantee we can include the following: 
 The Big Important Additions- 
Android and iOS Tablet Version, Linux Version – We've done a lot of groundwork earlier in development; but we don’t have the resources for a full port alongside our other work. Backing will ensure we can deliver Akaneiro as a cross-platform experience. 
Co-op multiplayer – Join with fellow hunters in real-time to take down the Demon Kings of Yomi. Share the reward and tackle more difficult challenges.
Equipment Crafting System – collect raw materials from fallen enemies and use them to add specific properties to equipment. Apply any properties to any item template, for the perfect blend of stats and aesthetics.
Improved Community Support – Any game, especially an independently developed online game such as Akaneiro, relies on fostering a strong community. We need to add more dedicated community managers to our team. 

 Other Smaller But Collectively Awesome Features- 
“Karma Void” Dungeons - use the crystallized hearts of fallen Yokai to access multi-level dungeons where extra-difficult challenges (and greater rewards) await. 
Expanded Narrative elements – more in game dialogue, and special ally characters added to certain missions. Lore items scattered throughout the world that provide further story for each mission and the game overall. 
Lockbox Items & Additional Consumables 
Hand/Fist Weapon Class and Mastery 
Expanded Weapon and Armor varieties. 
Additional Spirit Helper Pet varieties. 
Further training levels for all Abilities and Masteries. 
Mark of Sacrifice – Recover a portion of lost experience by returning to the site of your death. Earn bonuses by finding Marks left by your friends. 
Ghosts of Yomi – New “lost spirit” NPCs added to Yomi Village, providing repeatable quests for special item rewards. 
Leaderboards – track and compare a large array of progression stats.
Hunting Squads - organize and brand your characters into a single squad unit, sharing profit, items and other benefits. 
Akane Trials – Rank-based achievement system with rewards.
Improved Chat System with friends list management, room creation and other social features. 
If you believe, as we do, that the game needs these things – then demonstrate your support by backing Akaneiro. Beyond the financial support, the vote of confidence will do wonders for our team morale as we push toward the finish line. 
Your hunter is a fresh recruit in the Order of Akane. The Order is a Templar like group of demon hunters who fight to maintain the balance between humanity and Yokai (Japanese folk monsters and demons). 
The blood of slain Yokai crystallizes, forming glowing red Karma Shards. The power stored within Karma Shards allows hunters to master almost super-human combat techniques necessary when facing Yokai. They also receive a high level of training in tactics, survival and natural magic. Order members are often referred to as “Red Hunters”. 
The Order was founded in Japan, 300 years prior to the events of the game, by the legendary demon hunter and martyr known as The Red Girl - or Akaneiro. Akaneiro was aided by her close companions, the Dark Huntsman and the the Forest Mother. Dubbed "The Three", together they exemplified the tenets and disciplines followed by the Order; maintain the balance between human and demon, light and shadow – walk the shifting line between this world and the other. 
The setting is late middle 19th century Japan. The game takes place on the fictional Yomi Island, located north of Hokkaido. The island was the site of a great war between Human and Yokai over 300 years ago. Though defeated then, the Yokai have begun to reemerge. This time, they’re more dangerous – organizing into militarized groups under the leadership of the ambitious and powerful “Demon Kings of Yomi”. 
Yomi Island serves as a nexus point for the gathering of karmic energies, used in both natural and demonic magic. The hostile Yokai conquer and control Yomi Island, that they might open a greater rift between worlds. Should they succeed, it will – quite literally – be hell on earth. 
Along with an ever-growing number of hostile Yokai, Yomi Island is inhabited by a mixture of the indigenous Ainu and Japanese. These human inhabitants primarily occupy Yomi Village - a trade and training hub.
We are pursuing buy it all model because it offers more flexibility in sustaining the game after release. It's also a great way to expose the game to as many players as possible, broadening our community early on and helping us gather more feedback to improve and iterate as we release new content. 
Our intended buy it all model allows players to purchase our game currency (Karma). Karma is also earned constantly through regular play, so the option to pay is there for those that have less time to invest in daily play. There is no energy system. No hidden subscription, no paying for power.
We will never apply prohibitive costs to core game play content or character progression. Nothing will be off limits to non-paying players. 
Go here for a player-written explanation of our F2P model. 
If we’re fortunate enough exceed our goal the game, and our players, will benefit even more. We have a long list of additional features and content we’d love to expand the game with. 
Here’s a list of our major Stretch Goals: 
Linux Version - Now part of the stated goals. Estimated Delivery Date, March 2013
Ouya Version - $233,000 - Estimated Delivery Date, April 2013
NEW EXPANSION: EYE OF SPITE
Unlock the Devil’s Eye Mountain region - 8 new areas and 24 new missions, new enemies, bosses and increased level cap.
NEW EXPANSION: THE YASHA WAR 
Unlock the Fallen Fen region - 8 new areas and 24 new missions, new enemies, bosses and increased level cap. 
Blackblood PvP Arena – provided by an Order of Akane splinter group. Fight to the death in groups, or duel a single opponent.
Hunting Chapters - Guild Creation. Earn rewards for topping monthly guild leaderboards. 
Even more new Weapons, Armor, Abilities, Mastery Levels and Spirit Helper Pets…  
Devil's Eye Mountain - Region Map Art
If we seem likely to reach our initial backing goal, we’ll add more even more detail on our stretch goals, and the exact amount required for each. 
Spicy Horse Games has many combined years of experience making console, mobile and online games. We have been developing games as an independently run studio for 6 years. In that time, we've managed to attract great talent due to our offering a work environment that encourages creative involvement at every level. 
Akaneiro is just one of several projects that have marked the studio's determination to pivot away from the world of publisher-controlled console games and towards games digitally distributed direct to players. We want to retain the special independence we've built, and with your backing - we can.

Risks and challenges
Because the project is an an advanced development state, the bulk of the risk has been overcome already. Bringing a faithful version to tablets will present some challenges, but with support from technology partners like Nvidia, we expect to clear those without too much pain. updates.update_content:
Dear Demon Hunters, 
We know too well the dangers lurking in the woods. Life is a battle and we'd best travel prepared. That's why American McGee is developing "Out of the Woods" - a selection of 10 classic fairy tales presented as a table top Card Game, Illustrated Story Book, Coloring Book, and collection of Art Prints. 
The Illustrated Book delivers tales such as The Little Mermaid and Bluebeard alongside beautiful illustrations and an exploration of the moral lessons contained in each story.

updates.update_userinfo: Out of the Woods Kickstarter - Preview
"Out of the Woods" - The new Kickstarter!
updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
Thank you SO MUCH for your support of Akaneiro: Demon Hunters! It was my first Kickstarter and your feedback and encouragement made it more than successful. 
Now... I'm launching a new Kickstarter mid-July, 2017! And I'd love to have you all along right from the start.

Greetings Hunters!  
Writing this update I'm reminded of the "Bring out your dead!" scene from "Monty Python and the Holy Grail," wherein an old man, not wanting to go on the dead-cart, protests, "I'm not dead!" "I'm getting better!" "I feel happy!" Meanwhile, John Cleese insists, "You'll be stone dead in a moment."  
Well, we're not dead.

To those who are still missing items, You have my apologies. I have been unable to manage replacing your missing items due to a death in the family that resulted in an extended absence. To have your missing items replaced, please send an e-mail to contact@spicyhorse.com and put Alice Kickstarter Item in the subject line. Also, expect a significant update from American later today. Regards, Ophelea

updates.update_userinfo: A Word About Continued Development and Support for Akaneiro
updates.update_content:
Akaneiro Backers,
A little history and an update regarding Akaneiro development going forward: Development on Akaneiro started during the early months of 2011. Since that time, we've maintained a development team averaging 15 people/month on the project. In total, around 360 man-months have gone towards development, bringing our investment in dollars to nearly $2 million USD. In that same period, we've generated roughly 300kUSD in revenue - this includes funds collected via the Kickstarter campaign, F2P purchases in-game, and one-time purchases via Steam. In simple math: We've spent $2 million, we've made $300k, we're "in the hole" $1.7 million.

The majority of the unique player-created items are now available! Check your BackerKit accounts for your redemption codes.
There are two of you whose items are not yet available - we're working on getting some bugs out of the animation. Feel free to contact me at ophelea@spicyhorse.com if you think you're missing a code.
To everyone else, go get all dressed up in your new weapons/armor!

The art books are here and shipping! Also, we've uploaded codes for the digital art books. 
American spent two days signing art books and they'll start shipping from Shanghai later this week. They should start arriving in 10-15 days.
Also, awesome news...
We had extra keys for the digital art books so everyone has a copy! Head on over to and grab your key.

Today I bring to you exciting news. Not only have the bridges, statues and gravestones been placed in game (time to sight-see!) but the Backer-created weapons, pets and armors are coming soon!
Get thee in-game and see if you can find all of the new landmarks. And be sure to have Crystals available when it's time to purchase new items!
Ophelea

Howdy Backers!
I've just finished uploading 142 MBs of game documents to our redemption system. For those who purchased Design Docs, the keys are in your BackerKit. Make sure you don't stop the download half way through or else you'll have to start over.
Get ready to edumacate your brains!

campaign.story:
"Do you have a charger I can use? "
"Oh no! I forgot my charger at home!"
"Wait one second, I have to run back in and get my charger."

Over the years we had accumulated enough Apple chargers that having a cable handy was never a problem.  However, with the release of the new lightning jack for the iPhone 5 we found ourselves back at square one... having to remember our charger every time we left home.  Within days of having the iPhone 5 we had no choice but make a new friend - Nomad:  An Apple certified cable that has no home.  
While the aesthetics of the Nomad was important to us, the most critical aspect of our cable design was to make it Apple certified.  We had purchased too many knockoff cables in the past that stop working after a month. Creating a quality cable that would last was a top priority.
"This Keychain Lightning Connector Is Perfect for Emergency Charges" - Mashable
"This is going to be a breakthrough product" - Apple Magazine
"This idea is simple but brilliant" - Tecnabob
"The Nomad is a must have!" - CRNCHY
The Nomad is a 3" Lightning to USB cable that caps securely to your key ring
The Nomad loves to nestle between your iPhone and laptop!
The Nomad charging from a USB port in a vehicle
Dimensions of the Nomad cable
Designing the Nomad in 3D CAD
Prototyping the Nomad
The Nomad is flexible enough to charge from almost any USB port!
Pledge $30 to receive a Nomad plus a custom aluminum bottle opener!
Potential Packaging Concepts
Up until now
We have established relationships with three different Chinese manufacturers who we see as potential partners in producing the Nomad. One of these manufacturers, a reputable producer of iPhone accessories, provided us with the prototypes that are pictured and filmed throughout our project page.
Once funding begins
We will closely review quotes from these three overseas manufacturers and finalize our assessment of who will be the best partner in producing the Nomad. We do not want to accept any quotes prior to achieving our goal in the event that we exceed our goal. This would allow us to offer more colors and options!
Once successfully funded
We will have chosen a manufacturer and will be able to immediately move forward with the tooling of molds - followed by a full production run. The entire production run will either be overseen directly by us or one of our overseas associates we have worked with in the past. From there, each Nomad will be tested, packaged, and sent directly to Chicago where we will box and ship them out to you within days!
With a successfully funded project, we will get our first run of Nomads manufactured, packaged, and shipped to your key ring by February 2013.  Our ultimate goal is to make the Nomad available in the retail market.
The Nomad cable is patent pending
SUPPORT@NOMADCABLE.COM
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Manufacturing:
It was extremely important to us to find an Apple Mfi certified manufacturer to ensure quality. The cost of our initial run is higher than we would prefer. However, we did not want to compromise the integrity of the cable. 

Cost:
Establishing both a retail and manufacturing cost were a big challenge. While we were able to establish relationships with overseas suppliers, production costs were not available until hours before submitting our final project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Update #13: TwiMpulse Demonstration - TwiMplayer!
UPDATE #12: iMpulse White!
UPDATE #11: iOS News - Blutrol for games and Apps
UPDATE #10: Introducing the iMpulSleeve!
In case you want to take a stand...
UPDATE #09: STRETCH GOAL - OMG... SHOULDER BUTTONS!!!
UPDATE #08: ANDROID SUPPORT
UPDATE #07... MORE METAL!
UPDATE #06... Emulator support!
UPDATE #05... Illuminated Buttons!
UPDATE #04... T-Shirt artwork!
UPDATE #03... FUNDED GOLD!
UPDATE #02 - TwiMpulse Duel: BARE METAL (Limited Option)
UPDATE #01 - See photos of the Metal Finish (Limited Option) 
WIRED.com (Joseph Flaherty): "Micro-Sized Bluetooth Game Controller Overcomes Big Obstacles"
CNET.com (Rick Broida): "Confession: I've written about a lot of cool-sounding Kickstarter projects, but I've never actually pledged one. Today I made my first pledge -- not because I'm a hard-core gamer, but because I just love this idea." 
TouchArcade.com: "I think they might be onto something with the upcoming iMpulse controller. We’ll be looking to get our hands on one soon..."
AppAdvice.com: "The iMpulse Controller is the Little Bluetooth Accessory that Could... I'm pretty excited about the iMpulse. It's simple, practical, and best of all, cheap."
The iMpulse is a pocket-small Bluetooth controller for mobile gaming.
The iMpulse is built for mobile gaming. You can ALREADY play hundreds of iOS and Android games on the iMpulse, and we're constantly adding support for more games! 
The iMpulse is cute, tough, and kicks butt. You can finally play games like Temple Run, Pac-Man, Air Attack HD, and Dynamite Jack with the true tactile response of real trigger buttons, while you slide the thumbstick with abandon. NO MORE having to dodge your own thumb to SEE where you're trying to go.
"We at Nameless are very excited for the iMpulse controller. What a fantastic way to enhance the experience of a multitude of handheld games. Finally, a real console experience for iOS/Android!" Rob Smith, Nameless LLC
"Ok, this is the thing i have been looking/waiting for! Just today i was thinking about buying iCade Mobile but it's only compatible with my iPhone,not iPad and i was not too happy about removing my Vapor case everytime i wanted to play a game. Love that price tag (:" SickSilvo (Youtube visitor)
"Awesome." Jimmy (website visitor)
The iMpulse is a great complement to your mobile device/smartphone. Look at the added features you get when you own an iMpulse...
It's small enough to fit on your keychain, which is a great place for it, because you can use your smartphone to find your keys! 
We've also developed a camera remote function, which will snap pictures from the camera in your smartphone. Take self-portraits without that phone in your hand! No more waiting for passersby so you can snap that memorable group photo!
We want to keep the iMpulse compatible with a wide variety of devices, and are therefore equipping it with Bluetooth 2.1 (rather than BT4.0, which only works with 3-4 devices available). The iMpulse will work on ALL iOS devices, and current Android devices.
...and iOS 6, of course.
We've also ensured the device is compatible with different PEOPLE.  The iMpulse is ambidextrous, so you don't have to be!
Two iMpulse controllers can work on a single device.  This means two players can go head-to-head on the same screen! The android emulators are already compatible and two player games are on the way for iOS.
THIS JUST IN....
Feedback on this device through our website and Facebook page has been overwhelmingly positive.  People can't wait to get their hands on it.  We are thrilled to announce that our most requested feature is being added to the iMpulse - media control!  
- We have WORKING PROTOTYPES!
- We launched the iMpulse website in June and have already and have already captured the attention of over a thousand iMpulse pre-order buyers and followers! Our initial production batch will ship to them before the end of this year.
- The hardware, circuit design, and industrial design are done and we are already setting up for manufacturing.
- Our firmware has recently been updated with southpaw support, media control and a unique two player mode.
- Our first batch of 50 review units will be released Sept 27. 
We've made it pretty far on our own. The prototypes are fantastic.  You've got to play with an iMpulse to truly appreciate how much better, faster and smoother the experience is.
We are actively increasing the pool of supported games, with more and more developers coming forward to add iMpulse support!
So - we are still going through rigorous testing and refinements, however there is NO doubt - the iMpulse is everything we'd hoped for, and more.
Please visit our website - www.impulsecontroller.com, or join our forum community.impulsecontroller.com. 
The forum also has a "Developer" section where we'll be posting our free SDK and all the information any developer needs to add support for the iMpulse to their games.
We're also on twitter (#iMpulseCtrl) and Facebook (www.facebook.com/impulsecontroller).
Product Specifications:
Size: 2.7"l x 1.3"w x 0.6"h.
Battery: Rechargeable Lithium Polymer.
Battery Life: 10 hours playtime, 30 days standby.
Bluetooth Version: 2.1 low power protocol
Effective Range: 100 feet.
UPDATE #01: (09/21/2012)
We just got our Limited Option Metal Finish Cases (Pledge level $45 and $55) from the plating factory, and they're looking fan-tas-tic! Judge for yourselves...
Brushed Nickel iMpulse
UPDATE #02: (09/25/2012)
Our Limited Option Metal Case iMpulse Controllers were picked up incredibly fast! During this flash sale, we received many requests for a TwiMpulse Metal Option. We are now thrilled to report that our metal plating supplier has agreed to let us double our order at the same reduced "sample" price that he quoted for the first batch - WELL below the normal cost for this quality of metal finish - so THANK YOU Jim @ Artcraft Plating & Finishing Co.
Find it NOW in the pledge column and ACT FAST - available as a LIMITED OPTION - the "TwiMpulse Duel: BARE METAL" pledge for JUST $88!
BARE METAL TwiMpulse!
Shipped in Blue and White backlit versions, so you can tell them apart.
(And before you ask - yes, ALL iMpulse Controllers are backlit white. The ONLY Blue backlit units will be the 100 in this "TwiMpulse Bare Metal" pledge).
UPDATE #03: (09/27/2012)
THANK YOU EVERYONE!!
In appreciation of your generous support and enthusiastic response, we are proud to release a Super Limited FUNDED! Edition iMpulse Controller… the ".50 Special"
Inspired by cool 50's style, a dash of Bond and a sprinkle of Hefner, this brushed gold finish iMpulse favors formal wear, fast convertibles and beautiful things.
Always in your pocket to treasure and show off, the .50 Special is a Celebration of our reaching our target 50k, of appreciation toward our backers, of going for Gold.
We will make 50 of them, for $50. Charging cable included.
UPDATE #04: (10/05/2012)
T-Shirt artwork!
UPDATE #05... Illuminated Buttons!
YES, all iMpulse Controller versions WILL feature backlit buttons!
UPDATE #06... Emulator support!


Manufacturing: To cover the cost of dies for the plastic enclosure and to pay for the parts that go into making YOUR iMpulse. 
We will be manufacturing the iMpulse in Southern California, which offers a competitive and productive environment for PCBoard manufacture, component assembly, plastics molding and high quality die-making facilities.
We have after all created the iMpulse prototypes using SoCal resources, brains, talent and productivity!
With the support we get from Kickstarter, we can pull our local production resources together and provide regional employment. 
Simply - we need to achieve a high level of exposure rapidly so we can reach our minimum order sizes for the iMpulse, and begin manufacturing it.

We have done something right with the iMpulse - it's a device that many people have been looking for. Here is a product that's cool, convenient, affordable, and is multi-talented. Kickstarter is THE natural fit for a product like the iMpulse.
To reach our break-even point we need to manufacture another 4,000 units. While we're confident that we will reach our target one way or the other, the KEY advantage of Kickstarter support and exposure is SPEED. The sooner we achieve our target, the sooner we can roll volume manufacturing, and ship the iMpulse.
Kickstarter also provides:
- Attention from game developers and software engineers, who can incorporate our SDK and add support for the iMpulse in their games and applications
- Increased dialog and discussion, which lead to improvements in our product and its successors.
So - Bottom Line - we are looking for YOUR support to reach a KS target of $50k. This amount, combined with our total pre-orders, will get us to our minimum order volume.
We're a highly motivated team of designers and technologists, who have been lucky enough to pursue our ambitions of designing better products and experiences for people in the digital age. Check out our website to learn more about the exciting projects we've worked on.
Designing better quality game content and elegant UIs for apps and sites has brought us to our latest passion - creating accessories that maximize the promise of mobile computing while overcoming its limitations.  
The iMpulse is a classic example of our approach. While we think that mobile gaming rocks, and online/downloadable games and content are the cat's whiskers - we really can't embrace the idea of clumsily jabbing at and squeegeeing around our smartphone screen, trying to guess where we're headed and blindly guessing at obstacles. And cars/planes/tanks are meant to be CONTROLLED, not squashed under-thumb! There's a need for controllers, as the market is now realizing - but who wants something huge that either doubles the size of their smartphone, or requires a backpack to carry it around in? 
This project started a long time ago. Development began using the original iPhone! Our desktop charger/dock/controller was designed and functioning a couple months BEFORE thinkgeek.com announced their "iCade" April Fool's joke...
iMpulse's precursor...
Our prototype desktop model was named "SpaceDock", to accentuate the fact that it was a dock/recharger as well as being a perfectly capable controller.
At some point however, it struck us that what we REALLY needed to be focusing on was making our controller as small and portable as possible. And also that we needed to think in terms of our device as a general purpose companion product, so additional features (such as the keyfinder and the camera remote) would be essential to its success.
Control YOUR iMpulse!

campaign.story:
The G.E.E.K kickstarter project is to fund the artwork/artists wage for the upcoming self produced Graphic Novel- "G.E.E.K", written by Matt Cohen  with art by Axel Ortiz.
G.E.E.K is the story of one comic book fans journey from being just another nerd at San Diego Comic-Con to becoming the leader of a top secret government organization made up of the worlds pre-eminent "super geeks"; who's only goal is to fight the evil forces of SLICK (which is made up of lawyers, actors, fashion models, business executives... you get the idea). Bursting at the seams with geeky references, random trivia and celebrity cameos, G.E.E.K is a superhero book for the next generation; A love letter to all the things that make the Geeky world go round, and filtered through the mind of Bagged & Boarded's Matt Cohen.
-------------------
UPDATE 8/11: ANY donation of $20 or more now gets you a FREE digital copy of G.E.E.K (goes for current donors as well), and any less than $20 gets you a HUGE discount code for a digital copy.
UPDATE 8/27: Sneak peek at the first 4 pages of rough G.E.E.K art on the bottom of this page!
-------------------
Basically: I am about to produce/self distribute a graphic novel that I have written, and while I will take on the cost of manufacturing/printing/distribution, I would like to cover the costs of Art/Artists fees' through crowd-sourcing and Kickstarter. I was lucky enough to hook up with the incredibly talented Axel Ortiz, and while his work is amazing... it don't come cheap :)  100% of the proceeds would go towards paying the artist in full for his work, so the only one profiting from this endeavor would be a hard working artist payed for services rendered. I will also update the page with art as it comes in so the funders see exactly what their contributions are going towards. Basically- This is a chance for the comic book/nerd community to fund a geek's dream and to help promote original stories in a world of reboots and remakes.
G.E.E.K is not just a comic book, but the launch of a new brand that will ideally span many different mediums and live on in many incarnations over the years. 
In the coming months, myself, Shawn Depasquale (editor/letterer) and Axel Ortiz (Artist extraordinaire) have many exciting updates/content related to G.E.E.K, ranging from podcasts, to comedy shorts to live shows in the Los Angeles area; by funding G.E.E.K, you not only help bring a graphic novel to life but also an entire universe in which I plan on playing in for a long time to come.
If you ever wanted something different... something that spoke to you. If you ever wanted to be on the ground floor of an exciting new project... and hell... if you want to prove that just cause a fucker reads comics, it doesn't mean he can't start some shit...
G.E.E.K is for you.
-Matt Cohen 
It all begins...
UPDATE 8/27.
Hey kids... Want a sneak peak at the first 4 pages of G.E.E.K?

campaign.story:
Thank you for visiting our page!  With production complete and over 20+ hours of footage in our hands, we need YOU to help pay for the editing and delivery of the finished product.  Our team is standing by and we are excited about launching this to an international audience.  Please join us in showcasing the best of Albania!
STORY:  In the splendour of the Northern Mediterranean, I visited my homeland of Albania to discover both the old and the new.  Alongside my brother Nate, photographer and my "Cheshire Cat" Fadil Berisha, my boyfriend Rick Fox, actor Blerim Destani, opera singer Inva Mula, dancer Tony Davolani, singer Aurela Gace, footballer Lorik Cana, opera singer Ermonela Jaho, artist Capitol T, and more, we blazed a trail from the capital city Tirana to the sexy beaches of the Albanian Riviera and the rugged villages of the Albanian Alps.  I was also fortunate to experience the hospitality of Albania's leaders: Prime Minister Sali Berisha, President Bamir Topi and Tirana Mayor Lulzim Basha and to hear their messages of hope for a beautiful country.
I experienced many Albanian customs; eating, dancing, exploring, balling, shopping, sporting, etc.  I got to know the people, politics and economics of a young democracy in an ancient land, as I uncovered the Albania of today.
It was eye-opening to discover how Albania lives in me, witnessing the pride of the country and receiving the key to Korce, the city of my family's origin, and my Albanian citizenship. 
I am hoping to reach as many people as possible, so please spread the word!  Faleminderit!  (Thank you!)
With Love,
Eliza

updates.update_userinfo: DEAR ALBANIA from Eliza Dushku airs on PBS and APT's WORLD Channel tomorow night, Monday, January 4, 2016!!!
updates.update_content:
http://www.aptonline.org/catalog.nsf/vLinkTitle/DEAR+ALBANIA
Please follow the link above to stay informed.  The program is rolling out over the next couple of months.  Local dates and times are updated daily (usually 2-3 weeks before airtimes.)
Check in again if your station is not listed, and look out for the WORLD Channel premiere when there will be a big spike in coverage.  Visit the WORLD Channel Wikipedia page to see a list of affiliate stations.

updates.update_userinfo: Find out when Dear Albania airs on your local public television station and on WORLD Channel!
updates.update_content:
Hi Everyone,
Sorry about the problems on YouTube.  We thought this might be an issue so we have uploaded the film to another site and will be forwarding the link to you today, very soon, when the link is ready.  Thanks for all your kind responses.  We will be contacting you individually to resolve each and every problem so as to not avoid further delays.  Thanks for staying on us!  Again, apologies for the wait.  We appreciate you immensely!

updates.update_userinfo: Advanced screening issues almost solved! Stand by...
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone,
We are proud to offer you your advanced online screening!  You may have noticed an email from YouTube telling you that Eliza's brother, and the Director of DEAR ALBANIA, Nathaniel Dushku has sent you the link to the EXCLUSIVE advanced screening of the APT broadcast version.  If you have a problem viewing the video on Youtube, please remember that it is a private video that is only accessible because we have shared the video with your Kickstarter registered email addresses.  If you have a Gmail or Youtube account, please remember to sign in first.  Otherwise, please click on the links in your invitation email and you will be given access.

updates.update_userinfo: DEAR ALBANIA - Advanced Online Screening Reward Available Now!
updates.update_content: We have some great news.  Although there have been many delays and challenges along the way, we did it guys!  CLICK HERE - where you can see that our contract with APT begins October 1, 2015 and lasts for 2 years.  This means that as early as October 1, 2015, DEAR ALBANIA will begin to air on the WORLD CHANNEL as well as on 60-70% of US local public stations.  The press release from American Public Television states that because Albanian Independence Day is November 28, the program should most likely air for the 1st time by then, after which they have 2 more years to air the program as much as 2-5x or more depending on viewership.  We couldn't be more thrilled and we couldn't have done it without your donations and your patience!

updates.update_userinfo: More visibility for Backers of $1,000 or more!
updates.update_content:
Hello Everyone!
Happy holidays and all that good stuff. :)  We have some great news and a piece of content for you below so please keep reading!  We are still here and still pushing this uphill.  Even though we are pretty much "done", we still have a lot of work to do to get this on TV in as many regions as possible, including internationally!  Good thing is we love our product and we love what we do so this part yields the biggest rewards of all.  Thank you a million times for pledging and sticking it out.
